StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: National Sleep Research Resource (NSRR): Cleveland Family Study (CFS)

StudyType21.name: other_general
StudyType21.other_value: Sleep studies and associated physiological signals

Person.Organization: BRIGHAM AND WOMEN'S HOSPITALCASE WESTERN RESERVE UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by grant HL 43680, HL 113338, R35 HL 135818 to Susan Redline (PI) from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). The National Sleep Research Resource was supported by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (R24 HL114473, 75N92019R002). For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for [Cleveland Family Study] can be found here: Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 1995 Mar; 151(3 Pt 1):682-7. (PMID 7881656). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs000284 and phs002715.” Zhang GQ, Cui L, Mueller R, Tao S, Kim M, Rueschman M, Mariani S, Mobley D, Redline S. The National Sleep Research Resource: towards a sleep data commons. J Am Med Inform Assoc. 2018 Oct 1;25(10):1351-1358. doi: 10.1093/jamia/ocy064. PMID: 29860441; PMCID: PMC6188513.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Heart, Lung, Blood, and Sleep Disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Data use is limited to academic researchers conducting research in heart, lung, blood and sleep disorders, and their risk factors, and does not include the study of population origins and ancestry. CFS data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures, individual participant genotypes, phenotype-only analyses or issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All researchers requesting CFS data will be required to obtain approval from their IRB for their proposed project using CFS data.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Heart, Lung, Blood, and Sleep Disorders, IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HLBS-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Heart, Lung, Blood, and Sleep Disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
Data use is limited to academic researchers conducting research in heart, lung, blood and sleep disorders, and their risk factors, and does not include the study of population origins and ancestry. CFS data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures, individual participant genotypes, phenotype-only analyses or issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity. All researchers requesting CFS data will be required to obtain approval from their IRB for their proposed project using CFS data.
